The observation of mild retinal edema suggests early changes but does not indicate severe retinal damage or ischemia. The absence of more advanced features like hard exudates or cotton wool spots suggests that the condition has not progressed beyond the initial stages. These findings collectively indicate that the patient is likely in the early stage of diabetic retinopathy.

(3) Therefore, the correct diagnosis is Stage 1 Diabetic Retinopathy (DR).
